decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The shroud advertisement hereby permitted shall not be displayed until all the scaffold is in place and shall be removed when the scaffold is removed or within 6 months from the date of this consent, whichever is the sooner. This consent shall expire on [21/02/2024] and the advertisement hereby approved shall be removed by that date.  
Reason: The advertisement is only acceptable for a limited period, having regard to the amenity of the area in accordance with Council policy LP9 of the Wandsworth Local Plan (adopted July 2023) and the requirements of paragraph 132 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed [PY4527/001, PY4527/002, PY4527/004 rev A recieved 21/08/2023, PY4527/005 rev B, PY4527/007 rev B]. 
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.

Condition : 3 - The area of the inset advertising shall not exceed 9.2m x 2.5m and shall always form part of the larger shroud advertisement hereby permitted for the duration of the display.  
Reason: To ensure the sign does not have an adverse effect on the amenity of the area in accordance with Council policy LP9 of the Wandsworth Local Plan 2023 and to comply with paragraph 132 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Condition : 4 - No floodlighting, security lighting or other external means of illumination of the advertisement shall be provided or installed. .
Reason: In the interest of highway safety and of the visual amenities of the locality in accordance with Council policies LP2 and LP9 of the Wandsworth Local Plan 2023 and to comply with paragraph 132 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
description: Erection of a temporary decorative PVC scaffold wrap with an inset advertising area of 9.2m X 2.5m for a period of 6 months.
